s.text: Congress has used its delegation power to transfer its authority to states on several occasions.
For example, Public Law 280 (1953) gave several states on reservations.
A state may, for example, make enforceable laws governing tribes if Congress delegates authority to that state.
Tribes have, on occasion, opted for a blurring of boundaries (asking that state cops patrol reservation land, for example).
